channel.title: ABC News – Breaking News, Latest News, Headlines & Videos
channel.description: Get the latest health news, diet & fitness information, medical research, health care trends and health issues that affect you and your family on ABCNews.com

image.title: ABC News – Breaking News, Latest News, Headlines & Videos

item.title: Video Popular period-tracking apps raise privacy concerns after overturning of Roe v. Wade
item.description: OB-GYN Dr. Jessica Shepherd and Senior National Policy Reporter Anne Flaherty discuss the legal implications of using period-tracking apps in some states that have banned abortions.
item.dc:creator: ABC News

item.title: COVID-19's negative impact on caregivers and 4 ways to help them
item.description: The COVID-19 pandemic has had an outsized impact on caregivers.
item.dc:creator: Dr. Jay Bhatt,Smriti Kirubanandan

item.title: This is how mifepristone and misoprostol induce abortions
item.description: A gynecologist explains how the abortion pill works and what mifepristone and misoprostol do to the body.
item.dc:creator: Nadine El-Bawab

item.title: Monkeypox vaccine not 'a silver bullet', WHO says, as breakthrough cases emerge
item.description: Globally, more than 38,000 cases of monkeypox have now been confirmed, according to the CDC.
item.dc:creator: Arielle Mitropoulos

item.title: Video How to protect your pets from monkeypox as US cases rise
item.description: ABC News contributor and dermatologist Dr. Mark Abdelmalek discusses the latest amid monkeypox, including the CDC’s warning that the disease can spread to animals.
item.dc:creator: ABC News

item.title: Video How do medication abortions work?
item.description: According to data gathered by the Guttmacher Institute, medication abortions account for the majority of all abortions performed in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: ABC News

item.title: World Health Organization renames 2 known clades of monkeypox virus
item.description: The World Health Organization renamed the two known clades of the monkeypox virus Monday.
item.dc:creator: Mary Kekatos

item.title: New York City's monkeypox vaccine rollout has had some issues. What went wrong?
item.description: Experts tell ABC News New York City's monkeypox vaccine rollout has been plagued with issues including websites that have glitched and appointments filled in minutes.
item.dc:creator: Mary Kekatos

item.title: Novavax seeks FDA approval for COVID booster
item.description: Across the country, more than 110 million Americans have not received their first booster shot.
item.dc:creator: Arielle Mitropoulos

item.title: How to protect your pets from monkeypox after 1st-known case of human-to-pet transmission
item.description: Monkeypox cases continue to climb across the globe and in the United States, where more than 12,000 Americans have been diagnosed.
item.dc:creator: Dr. Jade Cobern

item.title: Over-the-counter hearing aids can be sold following FDA ruling
item.description: "Americans could see over-the-counter hearing aids available as early as mid-October," FDA Commissioner Robert Califf said at an FDA briefing Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Emma Egan

item.title: New COVID bivalent vaccine expected in US in the fall
item.description: "Start Here" speaks with Sony Salzman, a coordinating producer for ABC News' Medical Unit, about the new bivalent booster shot for COVID.
item.dc:creator: ABC NEWS

item.title: Video Doctor on back-to-school safety as coronavirus variants, monkeypox spread
item.description: ABC News medical contributor and Stanford Children’s Health physician Dr. Alok Patel discusses COVID-19 and monkeypox safety as schools and universities reopen.
item.dc:creator: ABC News

item.title: What to know about monkeypox transmission
item.description: Any prolonged skin-to-skin contact, including hugging and kissing someone who is positive, is another likely method of transmission.
item.dc:creator: Youri Benadjaoud

item.title: 8th child in US tests positive for monkeypox
item.description: Across the globe, nearly 32,000 cases of monkeypox have now been reported.
item.dc:creator: Arielle Mitropoulos

item.title: Video UK authorizes booster vaccine design to target omicron variant
item.description: Dr. Alok Patel, a physician at Stanford Children’s Health, discusses how the new booster could affect the fight against COVID-19 and medical experts’ concerns about monkeypox on college campuses.
item.dc:creator: ABC News

item.title: Video UK authorizes variant-specific vaccine in fight against COVID-19
item.description: ABC News medical contributor Dr. Darien Sutton breaks down the impact the new vaccine could have, and the latest on monkeypox in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: ABC News

item.title: Video By the Numbers: COVID-19 vaccines and variants
item.description: A look at the numbers behind the fall outlook on COVID-19 vaccines, boosters and variants.
item.dc:creator: ABC News

item.title: New York City officials host monkeypox town hall as disease continues to sweep city
item.description: New York City officials are hosting a monkeypox town hall Monday after thousands of vaccine appointment slots were filled over the weekend within minutes.
item.dc:creator: Mary Kekatos

item.title: Video New York officials assessing potential spread after polio found in wastewater
item.description: Dr. John Brownstein, epidemiologist and Chief Innovation Officer at Boston Children’s Hospital, discusses the Rockland County, New York, polio case and whether the virus could be spreading.
item.dc:creator: ABC News

item.title: What to know about the polio vaccine and why most people aren't at risk of infection
item.description: Public health experts tell ABC News which vaccine is used to protect against polio and why most Americans are unlikely to be infected with the disease.
item.dc:creator: Mary Kekatos

item.title: Polio discovered in New York City wastewater samples
item.description: Health officials announced Friday that polio has been detected in wastewater samples in New York City.
item.dc:creator: Mary Kekatos

item.title: Only half of eligible Americans have gotten their first COVID booster
item.description: Among people ages 50 years and older, the unvaccinated had a risk of dying from COVID-19 that was 29 times higher than their fully vaccinated and double-boosted peers.
item.dc:creator: Arielle Mitropoulos

item.title: Video US surpasses 10,000 confirmed cases of monkeypox
item.description: Infectious disease specialist Dr. Simone Wildes discusses the importance of vaccines as U.S. monkeypox cases rise.
item.dc:creator: ABC News

item.title: CDC no longer requires unvaccinated to quarantine after being exposed to COVID
item.description: The CDC released new COVID-19 guidance Thursday including ending quarantine recommendations for unvaccinated people who are exposed to the virus.
item.dc:creator: Cheyenne Haslett,Mary Kekatos
